page.title: 10THE EX-MAYOR OF WOODSTOCK.
page.content: We went to interview the ex-mayor of Woodstock Mr Wilmot. He enjoyed being mayor very much, to him it was a "great experience." Mr Wilmot was a very busy man because he had to go to meetings, parties and outings. Mr Wilmot went to visit a lot of people who he would not normally meet. He did not get any pay for being mayor. He only wore his chain of office on special occasions. The chain is made of nine carat gold.He also had a mace which his mace bearer carried. He had been on the Council for so many years that the Council thought he was ready to be mayor. The Council meets in the Town Hall which was built in 1766. The Town Hall is used for fetes and bazaars. The Woodstock archives are kept in the Town Hall. The library is just about to leave the Town Hall for new premises.
